												Overall rating: 9.5/10To anyone who enjoys visual novels/choose your own adventure stories, I cannot recommend this game highly enough.Story:In terms of story, they did an excellent job weaving a narrative that places the story of Cinderella in a context that makes sense. Your stepmother and stepsisters are more than just villians, they are characters/people with lives and motivations that you can choose to understand/learn about or not. The other characters you meet in the story also have histories and distinct personalites. Cinders' relationships with other characters are also affected by choices you make. References to the past/history are very fluidly revealed in conversations with people. The game does not just dump a bunch of backstory on you for seemingly no reason. The game is also filled with some excellent dry humor, and amusing banter.Gameplay:If there is a game where literally every choice has an impact, big or small, this is it. There are multiple personality types for Cinders (I've discovered three) that are shaped by the choices you make. Cinders' personality type will affect certain dialogues, the availability of certain choices, and the consequences of certain choices. Certain scenes or dialogues with other characters will also change depending on previous choices you have made. There are multiple endings with several variants of each, and it does not come down to one or two "big choices" at the end or anything simple like that. Whether or not you succeed in achieving your desired specific ending is dependent upon the cumulative effects of choices you have made throughout the game. That being said, the replay value is very high, in my opinion. I have enjoyed replaying it to find the different endings/variants and get the achievements.The only downsides in terms of gameplay are minor, but still exist. There is no good "rewind" function. If you missed a line, or want to return to read an earlier part of the conversation, you are limited. The game is divided into "scenes" probably for program/design sake. However, you cannot scroll further back than the first line of your current "scene." This could be several lines back, or just one. Fast-forward is sub-optimal. It just cycles through dialogue at rapid speed until you come to a scene/line you haven't viewed or a choice. You can't "skip to next scene" or "skip to next choice" which is disappointing on replays.Presentation:The artwork is pretty, from the character portraits to the backgrounds and facial expressions change over the course of conversations. The music is good, and fits the scenes quite well. My only gripe was that introducing a character meant briefly interrupting a scene to focus on the character on a leafy-flower design background and a change in music that felt a little out of place.Pros:+ Story+ Characters+ Artwork+ Choices & Consequences+ Replay ValueCons:- Limited/sub-optimal fast-forward and rewind functions- Awkward character "introductions"

												This is a lovely little game. Well, it's not really a game - more an interactive story. You click through listening to dialogue between the main characters and Cinders' thoughts, and, like a "Choose your own Adventure" novel, make choices at key points. That's pretty much it, as far as action is concerned.But it's such a nice experience that it doesn't matter. The dialogue seems a bit trite to begin with (and to be fair, is a bit stilted at times, with the odd sentence that sounds like it's been badly translated) but you soon grow to like it, and the story can go in one of several directions based on your choices. There aren't that many backdrops or characters altogether, but the art and music are so wonderful that it's really a pleasure to play through.Overall, I'd highly recommend this; it's just such a nice experience. Don't buy it, though, if you're expecting action, or puzzles, or a game - it isn't really any of those things. It's more like you're in the audience for a mysterious and beautiful piece of theatre that makes you feel like a little child listening to a storyteller.

												Cinders quenched my thirst for a fairytale story with characters who have depth and for the option to change how a classic story ends. Would you prefer to end up with this person, with that person, or on your own? Would you rather take charge of the kingdom, take back your home, or run away? You get to choose how this well written and beautifully brought to life story unfolds. During my first run, I chose to go with my first instincts on how to go through the game. It's fun to see how others go through the game as well. The friends I've sat in front of this game have all chosen very different paths for the sassy, independent main character in this Cinderella story.Overall, if you enjoy fairytales with a twist, try Cinders.P.S.By looking at the achievements I haven't yet gotten, it looks like you can choose a dark path. So, if you're not into the usual, happy trajectory of fairytales nowadays, there could still be something here for you.
